intro: Donella lanceolata var. malagassica, commonly known as the Madagascar lanceleaf, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. This variant is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species.
